result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pierce Andrew Abeita

records.addlTxt:
2:43 PM Defendant Pierce Andrew Abeita appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Janae F. Hochmuth appeared by video for Pierce Andrew Abeita.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Court finds PC.  State requests $450 cash bond w/conditions.  Atty Hochmuth states DE does qualify for PD appt and responds re: bond, asking for signature bond or no more than $100 cash - new mailing address provided.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  22TR6411 to track.  $250.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to operate any MV w/o valid DL.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Return date scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on November 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 4, 2022 at 10:45 am.
